text: Since we are on the topic of CUDA, which AMD GPU would you recommend to put into a desktop if you want to take the dark side for a spin?

elements.text: Since we are on the topic of CUDA, which AMD GPU would you recommend to put into a desktop if you want to take the dark side for a spin?

text: Vega 56/64

elements.text: Vega 56/64

text: Thanks, browsing the ROCm issues really is depressing in terms of how tight-lipped AMD are: <https://github.com/RadeonOpenCompute/ROCm/issues/1061>

elements.text: Thanks, browsing the ROCm issues really is depressing in terms of how tight-lipped AMD are:

text: Also I summon thee <@U6A0PD8CR>

elements.text: Also I summon thee

text: They are better than nvidia

elements.text: They are better than nvidia

text: But that is all the good I have to say

elements.text: But that is all the good I have to say

text: Look, better than Nvidia is a very low bar. ;P

elements.text: Look, better than Nvidia is a very low bar. ;P

text: Don't mind the ROCm issue list, it's mostly just people complaining that AMD isn't fast enough adding support, as a rather tiny company with highly complicated technology

elements.text: Don't mind the ROCm issue list, it's mostly just people complaining that AMD isn't fast enough adding support, as a rather tiny company with highly complicated technology

text: The ROCm stack has its flaws, but ROCR and ROCT work really well, in my experience

elements.text: The ROCm stack has its flaws, but ROCR and ROCT work really well, in my experience

text: And agreed, Vega 56/64

elements.text: And agreed, Vega 56/64

text: I suspect that's what their devs mostly do development with

elements.text: I suspect that's what their devs mostly do development with

text: Got it, my mistake was really to make the purchase in a hurry under the assumption that AMD-land was like Nvidia-land in terms of support for consumer cards. In terms of user land, I highly recommend Radeon. No issues at all.

elements.text: Got it, my mistake was really to make the purchase in a hurry under the assumption that AMD-land was like Nvidia-land in terms of support for consumer cards. In terms of user land, I highly recommend Radeon. No issues at all.

text: Not seeing any Vega 64’s on the market in Japan. But I will see what I can dig up. Hopefully the cryptocurrency gold bugs have not vacuumed them all up…

elements.text: Not seeing any Vega 64’s on the market in Japan. But I will see what I can dig up. Hopefully the cryptocurrency gold bugs have not vacuumed them all up…

text: Actually, no. I could try it in a week or two as I would need to rip my GTX out as it got a bit tight and hot in the box with two cards.
